medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe exacerbations of erythrodermic psoriasis precipitated by iodine-containing radiographic contrast media.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's psoriasis symptoms reportedly began in 1990, following her initial admission for erythrodermic psoriasis, which was resistant to treatment. After 1998, upon administration of iodine-containing contrast media, her skin began to deteriorate within 24 hours, leading to erythroderma. This deterioration occurred on three separate occasions with different contrast media, each time within 24 hours of administration.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Erythrodermic psoriasis, carcinoma of the caecum with hepatic metastases.
